The PSO’s Project Managers, in partnership with ITS (Information Technology Services) and GTS (Global Technology Services), develop and utilize standard project lifecycle processes, approaches and templates to implement new administrative systems and upgrades. Specifically, the PSO can assist with:          Developing business cases and project charters for new projects   Managing the overall issue escalation and project status reporting   Developing business requirements and functional specifications   Selecting software package solutions   Coordinating testing (user acceptance, regression and quality assurance testing)   Overseeing training and functional deployment to customers   Ensuring an appropriate ongoing support model is in place   Monitoring administrative systems and services project budgets     Visit the PSO Toolkit to learn more about the key tools and templates used for Project Management, Business Change Management and Business Process Improvement.                Project Management Overview        Project management organizes key components of a project, clearly identifying goals and objectives, and monitoring the overall progress against various constraints - surrounding scope, resources, timing and funding. Project Managers will typically utilize a standard project lifecycle, adopting best practices partnered with a set of tools and templates. Read more about the project life cycle .     The PSO Lifecycle aligns with the ITS and GTS Project Methodologies. Click here to read more about the ITS Project Management Methodology . Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                              The M.S. in Public Relations and Corporate Communication is a 42-credit program, including a core curriculum focused on communication, ethics, law, social media strategies, research methodologies, and regulatory practices. The degree also features a concentration, in either public relations management or corporate and organizational communication; a practicum project in which you prepare, present, and potentially launch a communication plan that meets a real need for a real organization; and a capstone project, which is a publication-ready thesis paper that makes an original contribution to the field.   The program is designed to meet the needs of both working professionals and full-time students, allowing opportunities for either part-time or full-time study in any semester. It can be completed in two years of full-time study, or in up to five years of part-time study.   The program, though mainly classroom-based, also is making important strides with distance learning, especially with respect to the pedagogical methodologies that will work best in what has been called "The Age of the Conversation." PR and News Team            Steinhardt's public relations and news team provides coverage of the school's events -- from its policy breakfasts to its graduation ceremonies. Working with faculty members, press, students, and outside agencies, team members shape the news and share it with internal and external audience, including social media sites. NYU Steinhardt publishes an online blog, a print newsletter, and a monthly eNews. Press releases, news stories, and announcements also appears on NYU's news site. Members of the Steinhardt community and the press are invited to contact us below.
